diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Tuberculosis of the endometrium and genital tract due to Mycobacterium tuberculosis
differential_diagnosis: Granulomatous endometritis due to other infections (e.g., fungal infections)
Intrauterine abnormalities (e.g., endometrial polyp or fibroid)
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with primary infertility associated with abnormal fallopian tubes and a biopsy showing noncaseating granulomas. Despite the absence of caseation, the clinical background (living in Nepal and India) and the findings pointed towards genital tuberculosis. Negative cultures for other infectious agents further supported the diagnosis of endometrial tuberculosis.
